value.description: Bacterial infection in a wound. Without treatment, the bacteria will multiply, killing local tissue, and eventually causing blood poisoning and death.\n\nThrough aeons of endless warfare, infections have often taken more lives than the wounds themselves.
An infectious disease caused by the influenza virus. This strain is adapted for only infecting animal species.
An infectious disease caused by bacteria. This strain is adapted for only infecting animal species.

An installed archotech eye. It perceives every type of electromagnetic radiation, including radio waves, infrared, light, x-rays, and gamma rays. Its visual acuity is precise enough to read handwriting from twenty meters away. It can emit various wavelengths of radiation like a flashlight, and has an internal subpersona AI which helps highlight useful visual information. Its internal workings are a mystery to our limited minds.

An installed archotech arm. It's strong enough to crush a thick hardwood branch in its hand, and precise enough to write a sonnet on a grain of rice. It looks and feels like natural flesh, but it's harder to damage than plasteel. Even if it is harmed, it repairs itself over time. Its internal workings are a mystery to our limited minds.

An installed archotech leg. It looks and feels like natural flesh, but a pair of these can move the user as fast as a decent car, and it's harder to damage than plasteel. Even if it is harmed, it repairs itself over time. Its internal workings are a mystery to our limited minds.

A biological heart. Pumps blood around the body.
A biological lung. A pair of these form the core of respiratory system.
A biological kidney. Filters and removes waste products from the blood.
A biological liver. Plays an important role in metabolism.
Nutrient-rich grasses and shoots, harvested and compacted for storage. Hay is loved by ponies and is also a good animal feed, but inedible for humans.

A hyper-advanced computer core that houses a peak-mind-equivalent machine persona. In its isolated state, the core is dormant. Installed in a proper support structure, however, it can become a mind of great power.
A humanlike skull.

The most seductive metal of them all. While it is too soft to be of much practical use, it is strikingly beautiful and never tarnishes. Millions have died in attempting to feed the endless thirst for gold.

A combined blade and tool-head attached to a sturdy haft. While slightly less effective than other weapons against living enemies, it excels at tearing down walls, doors, and other structures thanks to its integrated tool-head.
I had to eat animal kibble. It's like I've been treated like an animal.
I ate the meat of another sapient creature, raw, like an animal. This is a nightmare.
I ate the meat of another sapient creature, raw, like an animal. It was so... succulent.
I ate a meal made from the meat of another sapient creature. This is horrible.
I ate a meal made from the meat of another sapient creature. So pleasurable. If only I had some fava beans and a nice chianti.
Three artificial enhancements, and my weak flesh is receding. But I still want more machine power.
Four artificial enhancements and I am becoming more powerfull. But there's still some flesh that needs replacing.
Five artificial enhancements... Is there anything left of me? Or am I just a robot that thinks it's real?
{PAWN_nameDef} was taught that eating meat of [PAWN_possessive] kind is wrong and horrible. But one time, long ago, {PAWN_pronoun} tried it... and {PAWN_pronoun} liked it.
